title: Blended Language Education Design for Doctoral Nursing Practice Programs (Large-Scale)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic nursing knowledge and foundational understanding of research methodologies, with proficiency in medical terminology and academic text comprehension
context.additional_context: A practice-oriented educational course conducted in smartphone-centric technological environments, providing continuous language feedback through formative assessments emphasizing nursing-specific terminology usage and text analysis.

learning_goals: Over 90% of learners can apply evidence-based practice (EBP) process terminology and reports in clinical settings.
In blended learning environments, over 80% of learners use specialized vocabulary and structured expressions in online discussions when utilizing collaboration tools.
By the end of the course, over 95% of learners will independently analyze and utilize specialized nursing texts on a mobile-based learning platform

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
